attributes.action: Implement Irish Language Act in N.Ireland
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The St Andrews Agreement  (October 2006) states that the "Government will introduce an Irish Language Act reflecting on the experience of Wales and Ireland and work with the N.Ireland Executive to enhance and protect the development of the Irish Language".

rejection.details: The UK Government undertook two major public consultations on this subject during the period when devolution was suspended in Northern Ireland. Upon the restoration of the Northern Ireland Assembly on 8 May 2007, responsibility for Irish language matters passed, in the first instance, to the devolved administration. The Northern Ireland Minister for Culture, Arts and Leisure has indicated his intention to work with the Assembly Committee for Culture, Arts and Leisure to reach resolution on the issue of Irish language legislation. The UK Government awaits the outcome of that process.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
